_comment_info: BASIC CONFIGURATION - Settings most users will need to adjust
_comment_advanced: For advanced settings (folders, scraping, context extraction, etc.), see config.advanced.json
_comment_debug: true or false - enables debug logging to files
_comment_logging: Control console output by log level: DEBUG (technical details), INFO/progress (progress updates), WARNING/warnings (potential issues), ERROR/errors (failures)
_comment_two_step_processing: Two-step processing: use separate models for vision (Step 1: image description) and processing (Step 2: WCAG alt-text generation). Set to false to use single-step processing with vision_model only.
_comment_steps: Configure provider and model for each step. You can mix providers (e.g., Claude for vision, OpenAI for processing, ECB-LLM for translation)

ollama._comment_available_models_vision: Ollama vision models: granite3.2-vision (IBM Granite 3.2 with vision, recommended), llama3.2-vision (Meta Llama 3.2 with vision), moondream (lightweight vision model), llava (LLaVA multimodal model)
ollama._comment_available_models_processing: Ollama text models: phi3 (Microsoft Phi-3 3.8B, fast and efficient, recommended), llama3.2 (Meta Llama 3.2 3B), granite3.2 (IBM Granite 3.2 3B), qwen2.5 (Alibaba Qwen 2.5), mistral (Mistral 7B)
ollama._comment_available_models_translation: Ollama translation models: Same as processing models - phi3 (recommended for speed), llama3.2, granite3.2, qwen2.5 (good for non-Latin scripts), mistral

_comment_translation_mode: translation_mode: 'fast' (generate once in first language, then translate) or 'accurate' (generate fresh alt-text for each language). 'fast' is recommended for cost/speed.
_comment_prompt: Prompt template configuration: processing_files (list of processing prompt files), default_processing_prompt (fallback), vision_files (list of vision prompt files), default_vision_prompt (fallback), translation_files (list of translation prompt files), default_translation_prompt (fallback). For merge_separator setting, see config.advanced.json
